item.title: Is this command correct?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Tutorial:

It looks right, but I personally don’t professionalize in anything that involves website development, sorry.

Web development is my thing haha, I’ll help him :).

[quote=“b00mz1029, post:19, topic:436797”]Okay so after I vote, I do ::claim but it says I havn’t voted, here is the method where it checks to see if you actually voted, is it right?

[quote] public boolean checkVotes(String playerName) {
try {
String urlString = “http://www.google.com/toplist/vote-6948.html=”+playerName;
urlString = urlString.replaceAll(" ", “%20”);
URL url = new URL(urlString);
BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream()));
String results = reader.readLine();
if(results.length() > 0) {
if(results.equals(“user needs reward…”))
return true;
else
return false;
}
} catch (MalformedURLException e) {
System.out.println(“Malformed URL Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)”);
} catch (IOException e) {
System.out.println(“IO Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)”);
}
return false;
}[/quote][/quote]

Have you created the appropriate tables in the database?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this command correct?
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Okay so after I vote, I do ::claim but it says I havn’t voted, here is the method where it checks to see if you actually voted, is it right?

public boolean checkVotes(String playerName) { try { String urlString = "http://www.runelocus.com/toplist/vote-6948.html="+playerName; urlString = urlString.replaceAll(" ", "%20"); URL url = new URL(urlString); BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream())); String results = reader.readLine(); if(results.length() > 0) { if(results.equals("user needs reward...")) return true; else return false; } } catch (MalformedURLException e) { System.out.println("Malformed URL Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("IO Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } return false; }

item.title: Is this command correct?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

You can create a command for both client and server sided, but the problem is that it would be more efficient for the server sided command, because no one is going to re-download your client just to get a command to work and even if you do use a webclient and update the jar, that is still a lot of work on you.

Add this:

if(inputString.equals("::vote"))
                        launchURL("www.URL.com");

Under:

if((j == 13 || j == 10) && inputString.length() > 0)

Then make sure you add this method:

public void launchURL(String s) {
        String s1 = System.getProperty("os.name");
        try {

            if (s1.startsWith("Windows")) {
                Runtime.getRuntime()
                        .exec((new StringBuilder())
                                .append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ")
                                .append(s).toString());
            } else {
                String as[] = { "firefox", "opera", "konqueror", "epiphany",
                        "mozilla", "netscape" };
                String s2 = null;
                for (int i = 0; i < as.length && s2 == null; i++)
                    if (Runtime.getRuntime()
                            .exec(new String[] { "which", as[i] }).waitFor() == 0)
                        s2 = as[i];

                if (s2 == null)
                    throw new Exception("Could not find web browser");
                Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] { s2, s });
            }
        } catch (Exception exception) {
            System.out
                    .println("An error occured while trying to open the web browser!\n");
        }
    }

Read full topic
